fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A hidden, from the Backlog page, Story card with missing transition icons will be created while an error message happens due to a user's project permission.
 
 While trying to create a story issue card on Project A, trying to link an Epic from Project B, which this issue card owner has read-only permission, will generate an error message, preventing the issue owner to create this story card, since this user has not enough permissions regarding Project B.

 In Jira instances with thousands of users, it could cause a possible occult performance problem in long-term scenarios, in the case of many of these "hidden" tickets happening on daily basis activities from users interacting with issue creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create two software projects
 * Using a test user which has read-only (browse) permissions in the first project
 * Create an issue with issue type "Epic" in the first project
 * Create an issue with issue type "Story" in the second project
 * On the creation screen (during Story creation) choose the first created Epic
 in field "Epic link" and submit 
 * There should come an error message.
 * Clear the field "Epic link"  and submit again
 * Issue <projectKey>-*2* should be created
 * Browse directly for issue <projectKey>-*1*. The issue should be shown but without
transitions buttons

h3. Expected Results
No card creation while the configuration settings are not met.

h3. Actual Results
The Story issue card is created, with missing transition buttons. It will be searchable but won't appear on the Backlog page.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Story card being created despite an error message stating that it was not.

fields.description:
It would be really nice if we could have a mode added to rate limiting where we set a rate limit for all (or with exceptions, I suppose even) and it just monitors for rate limit exceptions and outputs those that WOULD have been rate limited.

So basically a test mode to see how your rate limit will affect users once implemented without affecting them to find out.
fields.summary: Rate Limiting Improvements, Testing
Rate limiting to perform agent specific evaluation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira cloud backup when restored results in the user directory operations removed

Attached some of the backup used

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test Jira cloud instance (https://nayka.atlassian.net/jira/your-work)
 # Create a backup of Jira cloud instance using _(setting -> system -. Backup manager -> create backup for server)_
 # use the backup on a Jira server / Datacenter to restore.  https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html 
# Login to the Jira server/ Datacenter with user sysadmin/sysadmin
# Observe the "Jira internal directory" operations are disabled

h3. Expected Results
# At the end of restoration of Jira cloud backup the "Jira internal directory" operations should not be disabled

h3. Actual Results

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-08 at 12.43.32 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

insert into cwd_directory_operation values (1,'CREATE_GROUP'), (1,'CREATE_ROLE') ,(1,'CREATE_USER'),(1,'DELETE_GROUP'),(1,'DELETE_ROLE'),(1,'DELETE_USER'),(1,'UPDATE_GROUP'),(1,'UPDATE_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE'),(1,'UPDATE_ROLE'),(1,'UPDATE_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE'),(1,'UPDATE_USER'),(1,'UPDATE_USER_ATTRIBUTE')

and restart Jira would make the Jira internal directory to get the operations activated
fields.summary: Jira cloud backup when restored results in the user directory operations removed

fields.description:
Currently on Jira, when ordinary users access the profile page, at the bottom of the page they can see all the groups they are members of; as well the Assigned Open Issues per Project. 

That being said, why don't also add/display in the profile page Roles they have in the projects.

That would avoid trite tasks like informing users of their roles in a project and save a lot of time for everyone involved for many users. 

!Screen Shot 2021-07-06 at 17.03.53-1.png|width=571,height=635!

 

Please take this into consideration for future versions.

Best Regards
fields.summary: Display non-admin users roles in their profiles

fields.description:
When using burp suite to intercept traffic and demonstrate the attack.

• In real time, Attacker have many options other than using burp suite (example : https://security.love/CSRF-PoC-Genorator/) or he will create his own malicious code like burp suite poc instead of intercepting the traffic.

• Network, Firewall related things : I heard somewhere, some of the Jira and confluence application accessible in public, in that case, attacker need not to bypass the firewall , he will create poc and send to his email to execute CSRF

Even if the application inside the network also , phishing link (poc) will execute the operation.

To Execute the CSRF attack we required , victim Jira/confluence current user session, cookie details.

• For that Attacker will create one phishing link and send to the victim ,once the victim clicked the link while logged in Jira/confluence, attacker will get the Jira/confluence victim current session OR

• Attacker will find the some other way to get session, cookie details ( like xss ,malicious JavaScript Codes, Predictable session token, Trojans ..etc (Refer : https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Session_hijacking_attack )

Of course , we have not identified direct bug to steal session , because of that we have given the risk rate of the bug as medium vulnerability.

May be in future attacker can identify xss or other scenarios to steal session in direct way.

Once the attacker get the victim current session ,

• He will create poc (create his own code of reset password/other functionalities of Jira/confluence application)

• And then send them through phishing link ,once the victim clicked the link while logged in Jira/confluence, reset functionality or other functions will execute.

So it would be great if the XSRF token can be enhanced so that it is more secure.
fields.summary: Enhance the security features of  Jira atlassian.XSRF.token

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira 8.17, "Refreshed commenting experience" is released, and the Comments tab UX is changed from the old one.

[Jira Software 8.17.x release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-17-x-release-notes-1063559166.html#JiraSoftware8.17.xreleasenotes-comments]


Until the new commenting UI improved or the user gets used to the UI, the customer wants to use legacy commenting UI.


h3. Suggested Solution

- Provide the dark feature to use legacy commenting UI
- Improve comment URL link(permanent link) button
-- legacy: there is a permanent link icon
-- new: we need to click the time area(ex: 25 minutes ago, etc.)

h3. Workaround 

- There is no workaround now.
fields.summary: Provide the dark feature to use legacy commenting UI in newer version (>= 8.17)

fields.description:
Hello Jira Team.

I would like to suggest a review of the method currently used to end Sprints with issues that span across multiple projects.

In recent tests, a customer showed an environment that had a Board with Sprints that had multiple issues, from different projects on it.
Once he chose to close the current sprint and move all the unfinished issues to the next sprint, only the issues in that project got moved to the next sprint, all other issues were moved to the backlog.

We understand that the issues are moved to the next sprint *only* when they respect the filter applied to the board that the customer is viewing.

That way, when changing the filter, we can move the other issues to the next sprint as expected.

However, the message in the UI does not warn us that the issues not appearing in the current filter of the Board will be moved to the Backlog and also does not inform us that they will be moved to the backlog of their own project.

This causes an impact on the productivity of the customer since he needs to search for the issues across multiple projects and relocate them all to the next sprint.

We would like to suggest having a review on the process for this kind of sprint. It would be more efficient if all the issues in a current sprint would be moved to the next one independently of the filter used in the board.

If you require more information, please feel free to ask.

Best Regards,
{color:#0052cc}*Benedy Melo*{color} | *Atlassian Support*
fields.summary: Closing Sprints Method

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User Picker Dropdown takes an excessive amount of time to load when there are thousands of users in Jira and up to 49 users in the Assignable User permission.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the permission scheme that is being used, set the Assignable User permission to 49 users or less, either using groups, project roles or individual users.
# With the user picker, whenever a user types a name into the field (assignee, reporter), the auto-complete list populates adequately.
#* However, when a user selects the dropdown to try and assign a user, it encounters a _timeout at 1 minute_. 
#* When using the api call alone, it registers at 1.7 minutes to load. The exact call being used by the dropdown is:
{noformat}
rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=&projectKeys=[REDACTED]&issueKey=[REDACTED]&maxResults=50&startAt=0&_=1559132212476
{noformat}
This is not something where adjusting the timeout will suffice because in no way should the dropdown timeout and take that long to load.

h3. Expected Results
 It should take less than a second to populate the list.

h3. Actual Results
It takes over 2 minutes for the list to load and at times, it times out. 


h3. Workaround
* There's a good chance it will only take a few seconds for the list to populate by adding 50 users or more to the permission. This will only happen if Jira finds the 50th user relatively quickly. 
* If Jira needs to iterate through several batches to find the 50th users then it may still take a very long time. Each search batch goes through 10000 users. 
* Until JSWSERVER-20336 is fixed, the workaround that is guaranteed to work is not having any assignable permission and relying on the project browse permission. i.e. Anyone who's able to see an issue can be an assignee.
fields.summary: User Picker Dropdown takes an excessive amount of time to load when there are thousands of users in Jira and up to 49 users in the Assignable User permission

fields.description:
Currently, whenever you perform JQL searches using the Sprint field, Jira will display both completed, future, and active sprints. 

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-02 at 18.27.31.png|thumbnail! 

It would be nice if users had the ability to restrict the options displayed for a particular JQL search, to display results that fit only the specified criteria. 

For instance, a user would be able to search for future sprints only.
fields.summary: Ability to adjust the options displayed by the Sprint field while performing JQL searches

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to learn when a restricted comment is removed from an issue via an information disclosure vulnerability in the comment notification functionality.

The affected versions are before version 8.18.0.

**Affected versions:**

 * version < 8.18.0

**Fixed versions:**

 * 8.18.0
fields.summary: Information disclosure issue in the comment notification feature - CVE-2021-39120

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow anonymous remote attackers to continue to view cached content even after losing permissions, via a Broken Access Control vulnerability in the allowlist feature.

 
The affected versions are before version 8.13.9, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.18.0.

**Affected versions:**

 * version < 8.13.9
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.18.0

**Fixed versions:**

 * 8.13.9
 * 8.18.0
fields.summary: Cached content persisting after disabling anonymous access for allowlist URLs - CVE-2021-39113

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user authentication is locked due to multiple failed attempts, the Jira administrator needs to access the user administration page to reset the failed auth count and disable captcha.


h3. Suggested Solution
Create a REST API method to reset the failed login count of a specified user.
 
h3. Workaround 
As a workaround the administrator can call the same requests Jira uses on the UI.
In these examples we were using {{curl}}, but you would be able to run similar requests on any coding language or on REST API clients, such as Postman.

When [secure administrator session (_websudo_)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-secure-administrator-sessions-938847890.html] is disabled, you can use the following example.
{code}
#######
# Adjust some variables
#######
JIRA_ADMIN_USERNAME=admin
JIRA_ADMIN_PASSWORD=admin
JIRA_BASE_URL=https://my.company.com/jira
TARGET_USER=user001


#######
# Check if captcha is required for the target user
#######
curl -s -u ${JIRA_ADMIN_USERNAME}:${JIRA_ADMIN_PASSWORD} \
 -H 'X-Atlassian-Token: no-check' \
 ${JIRA_BASE_URL}'/secure/admin/user/ViewUser.jspa?name='${TARGET_USER} \
 | grep "CAPTCHA required at next login"


#######
# Reset the failed login count for the target user.
# A 302 HTTP status response is the expected output.
#######
curl -o /dev/null -s -w "%{http_code}\n" -u ${JIRA_ADMIN_USERNAME}:${JIRA_ADMIN_PASSWORD} \
 -H 'X-Atlassian-Token: no-check' \
 ${JIRA_BASE_URL}'/secure/admin/user/ResetFailedLoginCount.jspa?&name='${TARGET_USER}
{code}
\\
\\
When [secure administrator session (_websudo_)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-secure-administrator-sessions-938847890.html] is enabled, you can use the following example which requires extra steps.
{code}
#######
# Adjust some variables
#######
JIRA_ADMIN_USERNAME=admin
JIRA_ADMIN_PASSWORD=admin
JIRA_BASE_URL=https://my.company.com/jira
TARGET_USER=user001
JIRA_COOKIES=jiracookies.txt
JIRA_HEADER="X-Atlassian-Token: no-check"


#######
# Get session cookies that will be reused on the next steps.
# The expected output is the HTTP status 200.
#######
curl -o /dev/null -s -w "%{http_code}\n" -c "${JIRA_COOKIES}" -H "${JIRA_HEADER}" \
  -u ${JIRA_ADMIN_USERNAME}:${JIRA_ADMIN_PASSWORD} ${JIRA_BASE_URL}'/rest/auth/1/session'


#######
# Authenticate as an administrator (websudo).
# The expected output is the HTTP status 302.
#######
curl -o /dev/null -si -w "%{http_code}\n" -c "${JIRA_COOKIES}" -b "${JIRA_COOKIES}" \
  -H "${JIRA_HEADER}" -d "webSudoPassword=${JIRA_ADMIN_PASSWORD}" \
  ${JIRA_BASE_URL}'/secure/admin/WebSudoAuthenticate.jspa' \
  -d "os_cookie=true" -d "webSudoIsPost=false" -d "authenticate=Confirm"


#######
# Check if captcha is required for the target user
# The expected output from the curl command is the HTTP status 200.
# If the target user has captcha enabled, then the grep command will show an output. Otherwise, it will be empty.
#######
curl -s -w "%{http_code}\n" -b "${JIRA_COOKIES}" -H "${JIRA_HEADER}" \
  -d "os_cookie=true" -d "webSudoIsPost=true" --output output.html \
  ${JIRA_BASE_URL}'/secure/admin/user/ViewUser.jspa?name='${TARGET_USER}
grep "CAPTCHA required at next login" output.html

#######
# Reset failed login count for the target user.
# The expected output is the HTTP status 302.
#######
curl -o /dev/null -s -w "%{http_code}\n" -b "${JIRA_COOKIES}" -H "${JIRA_HEADER}" \
  -d "os_cookie=true" -d "webSudoIsPost=true" \
  ${JIRA_BASE_URL}'/secure/admin/user/ResetFailedLoginCount.jspa?name='${TARGET_USER}

#######
# Delete the file with the session cookies.
#######
rm -f ${JIRA_COOKIES}
{code}
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like to use the REST API to reset the failed login count of a Jira user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Server 8.15.1, 8.16.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Jira Administration (GEAR icon) > Applications > Application Links 
# Within *What's new for application links* feature pop-up, click any of the three Learn More links

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-29 at 6.14.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
A page is loaded corresponding to the "Learn more" page pertaining to "Built-in diagnostics", "Better troubleshooting" or "Simplified security"

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on any Learn more link takes you to the following broken page
{noformat}Page Not Found

The page you were trying to reach could not be found: it may have been renamed or moved to another space, or the name you requested may be incomplete.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Click "OK Got it"
fields.summary: What's new for application links feature pop-up loads broken documentation URLs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some AUI functions get deprecated in the later version. 
 
h3. Suggested Solution
The AUI should mention replacement for those deprecated AUI functions, so customers know what to edit their existing scripts that use deprecated functions.

For example, AJS.params will be deprecated in AUI 9.0 and removed in AUI 10. AUI 10 documentation should list its replacement. 

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: AUI documentation should list down replacement for deprecated functions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some customers need to identify all requests that are made from the Jira Mobile App.
This can be useful for traffic routing policies on the load balancer or for troubleshooting purposes.

The mobile app should send the {{mobile-app-request: true}} request header on all requests.
This isn't happening on some of the requests.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a Jira Software vanilla instance.
 # Install the Android Jira Mobile App.
 # Access Jira through the Android mobile app.

h3. Expected Results
All requests made from the Jira Mobile App send the {{mobile-app-request: true}} request header.

h3. Actual Results
Some requests are sending the expected request header, some are not.
Here's an example of a request that sends the header.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Here are examples of a requests that doesn't send the header, but can be identified through the {{user-agent}}.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

If you need to identify requests made from the mobile app, rely on the following rules:
 * If the request has the {{mobile-app-request: true}} request header
*OR*
 * If the request is made with one of the following {{user-agent}}.
{code}
okhttp*
AtlassianMobileApp*
JIRA*
Dalvik*
{code}
fields.summary: Some requests made from the Jira mobile app are not sending the mobile-app-request header

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, Jira Software Data Center, and Jira Service Management Data Center exposed a Ehcache RMI network service which attackers, who can connect to the service, on port 40001 and potentially 40011 [0][1][2], could execute arbitrary code of their choice in Jira through deserialization due to a missing authentication vulnerability. While Atlassian strongly suggests restricting access to the Ehcache ports to only Data Center instances, fixed versions of Jira will now require a shared secret in order to allow access to the Ehcache service.

*[0]* In Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, and Jira Software Data Center versions prior to 7.13.1, the Ehcache object port can be randomly allocated.

*[1]* In Jira Service Management Data Center versions prior to 3.16.1, the Ehcache object port can be randomly allocated.

*[2]* The default Ehcache port is 40001 but it can be configured to be on a different port, see [Installing JIRA Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html#InstallingJiraDataCenter-parametersCluster.propertiesfileparameters] for more details.

 

*Affected versions:*
 The versions of Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, and Jira Software Data Center affected by this vulnerability are:
 * From version 6.3.0 before 8.5.16 (the fixed version for 8.5.x)
 * From version 8.6.0 before 8.13.8 (the fixed version for 8.13.x)
 * From version 8.14.0 before 8.17.0

 

The versions of Jira Service Management Data Center affected by this vulnerability are:
 * From version 2.0.2 before 4.5.16 (the fixed version for 4.5.x)
 * From version 4.6.0 before 4.13.8 (the fixed version for 4.13.x)
 * From version 4.14.0 before 4.17.0

h3. Fixed Versions

To address these issues, we have released Jira Data Center, Jira Core Data Center, and Jira Software Data Center:
 * 8.5.16 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 8.13.8 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 8.17.0 that contains a fix for this issue

 

Jira Service Management Data Center versions:
 * 4.5.16 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 4.13.8 that contains a fix for this issue
 * 4.17.0 that contains a fix for this issue

 

These versions can be downloaded at:
 * Jira Core Server: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/core/download]
 * Jira Software Data Center: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update]
 * Jira Service Management Data Center: [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-management/update]

h3. Additional details

For additional details, see the full advisory: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-data-center-and-jira-service-management-data-center-security-advisory-2021-07-21-1063571388.html]
fields.summary: Jira Data Center & Jira Service Management Data Center -  Missing Authentication for Ehcache RMI - CVE-2020-36239

Hi,

 

Can you please either stop truncating results from the autocompletedata/suggestions [endpoint|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.15/#api/2/jql/autocompletedata-getFieldAutoCompleteForQueryString] or document how a maxResults parameter could be used to increase the result count?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users that have a backslash in their usernames like *_ATL\johndoe_* don't receive notifications for mentions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new user and place a backslash within its username.
 # Mention the user using @ on any text field you want to (add it within a comment, add it on issue description, etc).
 # Wait for the notification to (not) comes up.

h3. Expected Results

The user should receive a mention notification.
h3. Actual Results

The user doesn't receive the mention notification and there isn't any error in the _atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log_ or in the _atlassian-jira.log_ showing there was an error during the notification fetching or something related.

This is valid *only for mentions*, all other notifications work as expected even if the username has a backslash character.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira won't send mention notifications if the mentioned user have a backslash in his username

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
An invalid startIndex parameter in search filter gadget preferences can cause no issues being displayed in the gadget even though the search returns issues in the issue navigator

h3. Steps to Reproduce
( problem only occurs sometimes with the steps below, not 100 percent reliable )
 # create 11 issues, with subject WidgetTest
 # create a filter 'summary ~ WidgetTest AND status = "To Do"'
# create "filter results" gadget on this filter ( Note: now whenever we sort the table of issues in the widget, widget preferences are updated via a PUT call to '/rest/dashboards/1.0/<dashboard_id>/gadget/<gadget_id>/prefs' )
# go to page 2, this displays only 11th record. Click on any table column to change the sort order.
# now edit one of the issues to chance status, so that filter has 10 issues now because of the status term in the query
# refresh the dashboard and it's empty (because it's still trying to display "the second page" (i.e. startIndex 10)

h3. Expected Results
Search results in the gadget match with search results in the issue navigator

h3. Actual Results
Search results gadget incorrectly displays 0 issues, even though the underlying filter returns issues

h3. Workaround
The following SQL can be used to identify affected search result gadgets:
{code}
select G.* from portalpage P
join portletconfiguration PC on P.id = PC.portalpage
join gadgetuserpreference G on PC.id = G.portletconfiguration 
where PC.gadget_xml = 'rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:filter-results-gadget/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml'
and G.userprefkey = 'startIndex' and userprefvalue <> '0';
{code}

And the following SQL will reset the startIndex parameter to 0 for all search results gadgets:
{code}
update gadgetuserpreference
set userprefvalue = '0'
where portletconfiguration in (select id from portletconfiguration where gadget_xml = 'rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:filter-results-gadget/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml')
and userprefkey = 'startIndex' and userprefvalue <> '0';
{code}
fields.summary: An invalid startIndex parameter in search filter gadget preferences can cause no issues being displayed in the gadget even though the search returns issues in the issue navigator

fields.description:
Since the Clustered Active Directory is supported for Jira, the Incremental Synchronisation often failed when the DC change to a different LDAP node. 

The following stack trace appear in Jira application logs:
{code}
2021-06-24 15:54:02,472+0300 Caesium-1-2 INFO ServiceRunner [c.a.c.d.synchronisation.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher] Last incremental synchronization took place for AD instance with invocation id 'xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxx1', current instance has invocation id of 'xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxx0', falling back to full
{code}
(i) When this happen, a Jira instance that contain large user base will experience performance issue due to high load from the full sync.

Therefore, it will be very helpful to have an option to allow incremental synchronisation when the Clustered Active Directory change to a different node.
fields.summary: Allow incremental synchronisation when the Clustered Active Directory change to a different node

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Currently, we can run a cron job at the OS level to delete attachments that uploaded to Jira a year or two years ago to save space for our ever-growing Jira home directory. However, there is no function in the UI to allow us to easily delete the old unused attachments. 
h2. Suggestion

As a Jira admin, we would really love to have the function in the Jira UI to allow us to click on the button to delete all the old attachments we no longer need.
h2. Workaround

Use the following plugin or run a script as a cron job at the OS level to delete the old attachments.
 * Jira Command Line Interface by Bob Swift

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-automatically-purge-old-attachements/qaq-p/393118]
 * ScriptRunner

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-Integrations/JIRA-Delete-all-the-attachments-from-all-the-issues-in-specific/qaq-p/858127]
 * Automation for Jira

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-Integrations/Automation-rule-to-remove-attachments-90d-after-issue-Done/qaq-p/1097521]
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, we'd like to have the Delete old attachment function in Jira UI

fields.description:
In step 4 of the bulk operations (Move issues from a project to another), the confirmation screens are a bit confusing, it's not clear what fields were selected to retain and which fields will be changed.
In the screenshot example, the screen in step 4 of the bulk change is confusing as it shows a fix assignee but that does not relate to the displayed issue type but to the components.
The feedback to the developers is to adjust the layout of the screen to make it better understandable which values are getting changed and which will remain the same.
fields.summary: Bulk change operation unclear behavior on confirmation screen

fields.description:
The Administer Projects permission provides the ability to change(as a project admin) the following areas. It would be a good idea to separate these as 
 # Project role membership ( ability to add/remove project roles or users )
 # Components ( Create / Modify )
 # Versions (Create, Edit and Release of version)
 # Some of the project details (Name, URL ,etc,.) 

we would like to possibly have options(Check box) to select each item from above list , to restrict users with "administer projects" access from making changes to project role membership.  we would want to avoid mistakenly granting access to the wrong users or groups via the roles administration screen.

(or) 

A Plugin similar to Version manager plugin that provides options to Manage Versions access to a given project role. This plugin allows us to delegate create, edit and release of version to user or project role independent from administer project permission.

 

Regards,

Prasad Kunchala.
fields.summary: Partially grant "Administer Projects" permission - Ability to chose from options.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Based on our documentation If you are a Jira Admin, you will also see the System tab, where you can change the columns for all users who have not set their own defaults:
 * [Configuring the default issue navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-the-default-issue-navigator-938847005.html#Configuringthedefaultissuenavigator-Mydefaults,filter,andsystem]
 On the other side, the following API call can set and returns the default system columns for the issue navigator:
 * [/rest/api/2/settings/columns|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.13.4/#api/2/settings].

That said, we started comparing the columns we have returning the GET of the API and the System tab, and we stated that they should match between themselves, we assume. 
 Also because this System tab is the only way that ADMINs can edit the default system columns through the UI.

During some tests running these APIs in a custom filter, we found one way to create an inconsistency. 
 We basically removed all the default columns using the API, so it started returning [EMPTY], in the other side, the "System" tab continued to show columns selected.

These are the issues faced caused by this inconsistency:
 * If you click on "Restore Defaults" button in "Columns", all the columns disappear;
 * If you go to "System" tab, it appears that we have Default columns selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

For some reason, when we open a filter, and go to "Columns > System" it brings data from /rest/api/2/settings/columns?_=ID_HERE, instead of /rest/api/2/settings/columns.

h4. +To reproduce the BUG:+
Obviously, this inconsistency can be created in different ways, because we started investigating it after an issue raised by a client. We are only showing that it's possible to be created:

Run the following API to check the default system columns:
{code}
/rest/api/2/settings/columns {code}
Compare with what you have on JQL filters > Columns > System.

To create an inconsistency: (Use an admin user)
 # Create a new filter;
 # Open it and Browser DevTools;
 # Go to Network tab (Clean it);
 # In Jira, click on Columns > System;
 # It should return a request URL with something like:
 # {code:java}
/rest/api/2/settings/columns?_=ID_HERE {code}
 # Copy "As fetch";
 # Go to the console, paste it and change the method from "GET" to "PUT" and Run (you must have Admin Rights);
 # Run the following API to check the default system columns: (It should return empty " [] ")
# {code} /rest/api/2/settings/columns {code}
 # Compare with what you have on JQL filters > Columns > System.
 # You will see that the columns are still marked in System tab.

The problem is that the fields in "Columns > System tab" are marked based on somewhere I didn't figure out yet.

h3. Expected Results

Marked fields in Columns > System tab and the output of /rest/api/2/settings/columns API should match between themselves.


h3. Actual Results

The fields marked in Columns > System tab and the output of /rest/api/2/settings/columns API are not matching.


h3. Workaround

As an ADMIN, open the "Columns > System" tab > check if the columns are marked > and click on "DONE".
fields.summary: Running API calls on /rest/api/2/settings/columns with filter ID as parameter creates an inconsistency

fields.description:
It is not possible to delete plans in bulk mode by Advanced Roadmaps today's design, which leads to a lot of effort when a user must delete tens, hundreds, or thousands of plans manually.

It would be much easier if a bulk option could be added when comes to deleting plans.
That would lead to reducing time expending with scenarios where can be quite challenging to clean so many outdated plans, improving by that customer's experience with Jira in general.

Today's documentation:
* *[Creating and deleting plans|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/creating-and-deleting-plans-802170502.html]*
{quote}Deleting a plan
 In your plan, click more (***) > Delete.
{quote}

fields.description:
Currently the jobs presented at secure/admin/SchedulerAdmin.jspa cannot be edited in any way - this includes the UI or even through database manipulation.
 !Current Scheduler Administration.png|thumbnail! 

We are not able to change their runtime, interval, cron expression or any parameter which they may have. Some jobs are not used and it would be great to disable them be it permanently or for troubleshooting purposes.

The idea on this suggestion is to enhance the secure/admin/SchedulerAdmin.jspa to allow editing.

Confluence seems to run in the same framework and it does have this feature documented on this page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html

PS: Some jobs can be disabled through feature flags if you reached this page in hopes of disabling a job.
fields.summary: Allow editing of Jira Scheduled Jobs

fields.description: Currently in Jira Align, if a child issue moves to in progress, the parent object automatically moves to in progress. However, if a child issue is already in an 'in progress" state, and then attached to a parent object, the parent object does not automatically move to in progress. We would like if the parent object could identify the state of the child issue no matter what instead of the transition from open to in progress so that it is automatically updated.

fields.description:
When changing the Fix Version field, the history should display the values currently assigned to it on the "New Value" column.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Assign three versions to an issue. Examine the history of the issue and we see the following row:
||Original Value||New Value||
| |Version 1.0 
 Version 2.0 
 Version 3.0|

 # Remove one of the versions (i.e. Version 1.0) from the issue. Examine the history of the issue and we see the following row:
||Original Value||New Value||
|Version 1.0| |

h4. Expected behavior
 * The expected behavior would be the history field "New Value" to display the values that are currently assigned to this field. In this example, it'd be the following:
||Original Value||New Value||
|Version 1.0 
 Version 2.0 
 Version 3.0|Version 2.0 
 Version 3.0|

This would be easier for users to examine the history field and easily determine what the values currently assigned to an issue by simply examining the latest entry.

(on) This would be a similar behavior of the label field, for example.
fields.summary: When changing the Fix Version field, the history should display the values currently assigned to it.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try to import a project from a manually edited XML Backup that is located on a directory Jira cannot read, Jira throws a message about the structure of the file being incorrect instead of the permission error. The permission error appears normally if you try to import the whole XML Backup instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a XML Backup, removing a row from the {{CustomFieldValue}} parameters for example
 # Compress the two files into a XML Backup again
 # Try to import a project from that XML Backup located in a directory Jira has issues to access

h3. Expected Results

Jira should throw the following error:
{code}"The file at /data/atlassian/application-data/jira/import/repack-bad.zip was not readable by the Jira process. Please check the file's permissions."{code}

h3. Actual Results

Jira throws the below exception instead even though the file is OK:

{code}"The file '/data/atlassian/application-data/jira/import/repack-bad.zip' is not a valid Jira backup."{code}

h3. Workaround

In this case, trying to import the file as  whole XML backup and not only a project from it showed the proper error which helped troubleshooting the issue.
fields.summary: Importing project from edited XML backup throws wrong error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The version number and Server time is displayed on accessing Jira using the below URL :  http://localhost:44134/j4134/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-fullcontent/temp/SearchRequest.htmljqlQuery=order+by+created+DESC&tempMax=1000
even to unauthenticated users 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Jira using given URL as un-authenticated users
 # You will be able to view the screen as given below disclosing version number and server time

h3. Expected Results

it should not disclose any results.
h3. Actual Results

It shows version number and server time
h3. Workaround

no workaround available
fields.summary: version number and server time is displayed

fields.description: As of now, "jira.table.cols.subtasks" is using the data type: String which has a character limit of 255. This needs to be increased to ensure more data can be added to the field.
fields.summary: "jira.table.cols.subtasks" field add more character
Replace "<JIRA_SHARED_HOME>/old"  under the "Failover to the Standby Instance" section with "<JIRA_SHARED_HOME>/indexarchive"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Vertical scroll missing in the description field when edit issue with Text Mode
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue with a long description
 # Click the Edit button on the issue you created
 # Select text mode for the description field
 # Update issue
 # Click Edit button again

!JRASERVER-72537.gif|width=567,height=366!
h3. Expected Results

Can scroll properly in the description field
h3. Actual Results

Cannot scroll until switching to the visual mode or editing a field
h3. Workaround

Click the description field and move text cursor or switching to visual mode once.
fields.summary: Vertical scroll missing in the description field when edit issue with Text Mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The current attachments directory is hardcoded, this is a limitation for many customers.

It would be nice to have a feature that allows to archive Jira attachments while they remain accessible when accessing an issue.

 
h3. Workaround
 * What Jira allows is to archive attachments which are no longer required by moving them out, but JIRA application will throw an error if an attempt is made to access the attachments which are archived out.
 [Managing attachments in JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/managing-attachments-in-jira-applications-300811049.html]
 * [Change the location of attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-the-attachments-directory-location-for-jira-server-237569020.html] and then create a symbolic link on Jira Server.
fields.summary: Archiving of attachments in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira's replication queue gets full, we are presented to a message that points us to the maximum queue size and the queue property to change, if we wish to increase it.

When the PUT queue gets full, the message points to {{jira.cache.replication.localq.queue.max.size}}, and not {{jira.cache.replication.localq.put.queue.max.size}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an instance with a large number of users
 # Change many users' properties in less than one hour (default user directory sync period)

h3. Expected Results

If the queue gets full, we'd see a WARN message like this in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code}
2021-06-15 06:19:45,006-0400 http-nio-8080-exec-5 WARN user123 279x18163x1 17lze88 XX.XXX.XXX.XXX /rest/configuration-manager/1.0/cacherefresh [c.a.j.c.d.localq.tape.TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue] [LOCALQ] [VIA-COPY] Cache replication queue is full (size: 10000). Cache replication events are dropped and not added to this queue: [queueId=queue_node1_0_2c177fc9a73549bf63b836dc4124cadc_put, queuePath=/opt/jira/data/jira-0/localq/queue_node1_0_2c177fc9a73549bf63b836dc4124cadc_put]. Number of dropped cache replication events: 1. Probably node: node1 is unreachable. If this is a desired state please shut down this node properly, i.e make sure it is not in state: ACTIVE in the DB: clusternode. If this is not expected caches on node: node1 are now inconsistent with this node. Maximum queue size can be set via system property: jira.cache.replication.localq.put.queue.max.size.
{code}

h3. Actual Results

If the queue gets full, we'd see a WARN message like this in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code}
2021-06-15 06:19:45,006-0400 http-nio-8080-exec-5 WARN user123 279x18163x1 17lze88 XX.XXX.XXX.XXX /rest/configuration-manager/1.0/cacherefresh [c.a.j.c.d.localq.tape.TapeLocalQCacheOpQueue] [LOCALQ] [VIA-COPY] Cache replication queue is full (size: 10000). Cache replication events are dropped and not added to this queue: [queueId=queue_node1_0_2c177fc9a73549bf63b836dc4124cadc_put, queuePath=/opt/jira/data/jira-0/localq/queue_node1_0_2c177fc9a73549bf63b836dc4124cadc_put]. Number of dropped cache replication events: 1. Probably node: node1 is unreachable. If this is a desired state please shut down this node properly, i.e make sure it is not in state: ACTIVE in the DB: clusternode. If this is not expected caches on node: node1 are now inconsistent with this node. Maximum queue size can be set via system property: jira.cache.replication.localq.queue.max.size.
{code}
(i) Notice that {{jira.cache.replication.localq.queue.max.size}} in the end of the message

h3. Workaround

Keep the values in the two properties different, to be able to properly differentiate them.

(i) *Note*:
The property {{jira.cache.replication.localq.put.queue.max.size}} was introduced in Jira 8.12 as 10,000 as default, and the default was increased to 100,000 in Jira 8.16.0/8.13.6 to prevent large user cache replication issues
fields.summary: Cache replication full queue message shows wrong property

fields.description:
Currently, Jira users are limited to see only 10 occurrences per page on the Project user and Role screen, and for projects with a large load of users, groups, and roles, would be good that the users could set the number of occurrences per page, from 10 to 100 for example.

!Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 17.35.40.png|width=562,height=339!

Please take this suggestion into consideration for future Jira versions.

Best Regards.
fields.summary: Increase the number of Occurrences on the Projects User and Roles page

fields.description:
In Jira DC there are quite a few operations which performance and stability depends on the shared file system performance/availability:
 * downloading/uploading attachments
 * viewing attachment thumbnails
 * email templates
 * avatars

Jira should provide some data about how the shared file system operations affect Jira performance/stability.
fields.summary: Jira DC should expose some data about the performance of the shared file system

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Running a groovy script to delete a linked issue from the current issue throws an Indexing exception in the UI. The same was working fine in Jira 8.5 version, the issue is observed with Jira 8.13 version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Edit workflow of your choice
 * Add transition From status: any status To status: itself. Name it: “TEST”
 * Add post function: Scripted (Groovy) Operation on Issue Post-function
 * Publish your workflow

Now, test the script on a linked issue: 


 1. Create issue in project associated with your published workflow .
 2. Create linked issue which is blocked by the formerly created issue .
 3. Select this linked issue .
 4. Trigger transition <TEST> 
 5. Error appears in the UI, but note that the issue deletion gets completed anyway.
h3. Expected Results

Delete the linked issue without exception appearing in the UI. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in UI:
{noformat}
ERROR      [c.a.j.web.servlet.InternalServerErrorServlet] {errorId=6dab4c83-d7a1-4ea3-a6b2-a283cf2d83d6, interpretedMsg=, cause=com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 1 errors, stacktrace=com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 1 errors
    	at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:189) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:863) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.await(DefaultIndexManager.java:843) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.executeWithIndexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:830) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:618) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:597) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:581) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.release(DefaultIndexManager.java:570) [classes/:?]
    	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:?]
    	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:?]
    	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:?]
    	at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:566) [?:?]
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Currently, there is no workaround for this issue on Jira Server Instance.
 * For *Data Center*, there is a functionality to archive the issue which removes the issue from indexing.
fields.summary: Indexing error in the UI when deleting a linked issue via groovy script

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow an unauthenticated user to enumerate users via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in the QueryComponentRendererValue!Default.jspa endpoint.

This vulnerability was discovered by Mikhail Klyuchnikov of Positive Technologies.

The affected versions are before version 8.5.13, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.5, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.15.1.

 It is reported that this affects version 8.16

*Affected versions:*

* 8.16
 * version < 8.5.13
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.5
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.1
fields.summary: 8.16 - User Enumeration via /QueryComponentRendererValue!Default.jspa endpoint - CVE-2020-36289

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 If we set the Number of Working hours per day equals to 7, and then try to enter "18.4d" in the original Estimate Field, there is an error on the UI "The Original Estimate specified is not valid". We can successfully enter other values like "18.1d" or "18.2d"


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit Time Tracking config and set the number of Hours per day equals to 7.
 # Try to Enter 18.4d in "Original Estimate Field"
 !Screenshot 2021-06-21 at 10.41.06 AM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
Value for Original Estimate Field should be successfully set.

h3. Actual Results
There is an error on UI  "The Original Estimate specified is not valid".
 !Screenshot 2021-06-21 at 10.39.05 AM.png|thumbnail! 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Instead of 18.4d, if we enter *128h 48m* which is equivalent to 18.4d with 7 hours per day, the value can be entered successfully.
fields.summary: Cannot Enter 18.4d value in Original Estimate Field while setting Number of hours in a day equals to 7

fields.description:
Currently, a Jira administrator can restrict the ability to edit a custom field by removing it from the *Edit Issue Screen*. However, this measure causes the field to not be editable by anyone. 

The value provided by Jira would be increased if a Jira administrator could restrict a user's ability to edit certain custom fields based on project roles and/or the user's groups.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to restrict the ability to edit custom fields based on project roles and/or groups

fields.description:
User needs new conditions and validators to prevent issues to be transitioned to a closed status when Assignee field is Unassigned, however, the conditions and validators to match this request are not available.



Jira Server 8.5

Jira Service Management 4.5
fields.summary: Add new conditions and validators to workflow transition

fields.description:
E.g. The customer has an extensive set of Statuses and needs to filter issues by all statuses but one specific status. 

On JQL basic mode, the customer should select status, one by one, except the one that will not be included on the filter.

It will be cool if the user can check a "Select All" checkbox and then uncheck the desired status to exclude him from the filter.
fields.summary: Select all options at once on JQL basic mode

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira, a user can create sub-tasks that are linked directly to the parent issue by using the *Create sub-task* option available in the *More* menu.

It would reduce the amount of clicking and facilitate the creation process if we were able to create linked issues of all issue types using functionalities similar to the *Create sub-task* option.

Also, this would reduce errors while creating/linking issues to their parents.
fields.summary: Allow the creation of linked issues of all issue types through the More menu
Pressing key b as a shortcut throws JS error

fields.description:
Hello team.

We want to suggest adding to Jira which status is connected to which workflow or Issue types when configuring the board in the *_"Board Configuration > Columns"_* screen.

Our customer multiple Issue types, Workflow, Boards, and Status. Therefore, he would like to have a proper way to identify to which Workflow or issue types a set status belongs, so he could organize the boards accordingly.

As you can see in the screenshot below, he has multiple statuses that cause the organization of the board to be confusing without knowing to which workflow or issue type that status belongs.

Best Regards,
{color:#0052cc}*Benedy Melo*{color} | *Atlassian Support*
fields.summary: Identification of Status in the Board Admin Screen

fields.description:
For administrators who want to auto-deploy, the post-upgrade display page that lists any errors or changes that have not been carried over makes automated login/testing difficult or impossible.  

What we would like to see is a way to disable this page from displaying on the first login after upgrade, such as a parameter in the jira-config.properties file.
fields.summary: Disable post-upgrade warning page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As per documented on [Audit log events in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0812/audit-log-events-in-jira-1026529308.html], after Jira *8.12.0*, the *Issues exported* event should be audited in the *Audit logs* when changing the *End user activity* coverage level to *Advanced*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Audit logs
# Change the *End user activity* coverage level to *Advanced*
# Export some issue

h3. Expected Results
The export should appear as log on the Audit logs page

h3. Actual Results
The exported issues action is not appearing on the Audit logs page

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Audit log not auditing "Issues exported" action

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When *com.atlassian.mobile.simplified.mode* dark feature is enabled for Jira Mobile plugin, when Users access Jira from mobile's browser, the attachment thumbnails won't be rendered. 

In the log, we'll see:
{noformat}
Unable to obtain attachment No usable issue stored in the context, unable to resolve filename 'XXXYYYZZZ.png'
{noformat}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Enable *com.atlassian.mobile.simplified.mode* dark feature ([Enable Dark Feature in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html])
# User access Jira issue with attachments via mobile's browser.

h4. Expected Result
Attachment thumbnails will be rendered correctly.

h4. Actual Result
Attachment thumbnails will not be rendered. The log will show:
{noformat}
Unable to obtain attachment No usable issue stored in the context, unable to resolve filename 'XXXYYYZZZ.png'
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Jira's Mobile plugin doesnt parse issue context, causing attachment thumbnail to not get rendered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the ability to create issues has been disabled via workflow permission for all users, one can still create a new issue via the GUI. The REST API disallows this (which feels like the correct behavior).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the workflow of issue type T in project P
 # Click View Properties at the initial step e.g. Open
 # Add this property:
{code:java}
Key: jira.permission.createissue.denied
Value: true
{code}

 # Publish the workflow
 # Attempt to create a new issue P-1 via the GUI using issue type T in project P
 # Attempt to create another issue via the REST API.

h3. Expected Results

No new issues can be created, as this ability has been disabled by the workflow permission.
h3. Actual Results

A new issue can still be created via the GUI (using the "Create" button or the inline issue create functionality).

However, Issues cannot be created via the REST API or via the "clone" button in the GUI. The workflow permissions are only being ignored when creating new issues in the GUI.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Workflow Permissions around issue creation are not enforced consistently between the UI & REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using our [configuration tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-jira-application-configuration-tool-938847894.html] to add a new connector to Jira, the *relaxedPathChars="[]|"* and *relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"* parameters are not included, causing Jira to fail starting up.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software 8.17.0
 # Run the [application configuration tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-jira-application-configuration-tool-938847894.html] to add a new HTTPS connector
# Save the changes

h3. Expected Results
A connector will be added with all required parameters

h3. Actual Results
*relaxedPathChars="[]|"* and *relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"* will be missing.


h3. Workaround

Follow the steps from [Jira server startup fails with Tomcat misconfigured error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-server-startup-fails-with-tomcat-misconfigured-error-958453799.html] to add the missing parameters to the affected connector
fields.summary: Adding a new connector using Jira's application configuration tool does not include required parameters

fields.description:
Currently our latest available Jira version includes AdoptOpenJDK 1.8.0_275, which does not include a fix for the following vulnerabilities:
* https://openjdk.java.net/groups/vulnerability/advisories/2021-04-20

It affects AdoptOpenJDK up to 1.8.0_282, so we should bundle Jira with AdoptOpenJDK 1.8.0_292.
fields.summary: Upgrade bundled Java to 8u292+

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the name of the sprint (without any spaces) is long, then we notice that the names overlap with each other and display distorted in the epic burndown chart. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have one epic created with 4-5 stories
 # Add each story to a different sprint. That means you need to have around 5 sprints created and started.  
# Now click on Reports --> Epic Burndown and notice the X-Axis which contains sprint names. 

h3. Expected Results
The names of the sprint display properly. (check screenshot - Screenshot 2021-06-14 at 8.57.07 PM)

h3. Actual Results
The names of the sprints are distorted. 

h3. Workaround
The sprint names with spaces don't seem to have this problem.

Is it possible to include the pages from all the links and not just the PRIMARY?

fields.description:
Hello,

As mentioned in [this Github issue|https://github.com/stevehipwell/helm-charts/issues/234], Steve Hipwell and I propose to create to new endpoint on Jira Software Server/Datacenter.

An endpoint
{code:java}
/live{code}
which sends back a 200 HTTP code every time the application is up and running, even during re-indexation.

 

An endpoint
{code:java}
/ready{code}
which sends back the appropriate HTTP code if the application is ready for end users or not.

 

 

The problem is: while Jira is Full re-indexing, it sends a 5xx HTTP code to front-end (on both endpoints"/_"_ and "/status_"_).
However Kubernetes watches for the application state and a 5xx HTTP code means "application down" and Kubernetes restarts it.
It's problematic when re-indexing.

Kubernetes good practices indicates that an application should have two endpoints as mentioned before because Kubernetes has _readinessProbe_ and _LivenessProbe_ mechanisms that doesn't fit well with actual Jira endpoints.

Today I used a workaround to watch out HTTP port but it is inaccurate compared to application endpoints.

Do you think that these modifications could be done ?

I declared component _ADGS Design Changes_, feel free to change it if needed.

Thank you
fields.summary: Re-indexing problem on Kubernetes with Jira Server

fields.description:
Issue: When retrieving issues via the REST API the "epic name" field is blank for issues that are linked to an epic issue.  I have searched the forums/web and this seems to be a known issue. See:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Team-managed-projects-questions/Why-is-Epic-Name-blank-in-All-issues-view/qaq-p/1366207]

I would like to add my name to the list of people who would like to see an "Linked Epic Name" field which contains the name of the linked epic and have it populated in the results returned from the REST API. Continuing to have the Epic ID in the Epic Link column is fine. I just need the linked Epic Name to be included when the issue has an Epic Link attached.

When we search for issues via the Jira web interface, the system displays the epic name in the Epic Link column on the screen and the Epic Name column is blank. If I export from the issues page to Excel or XML, it matches what is displayed: epic link column contains name not the ID and epic name is blank. Exporting to CSV gives me same result and what is returned from REST API: Epic Link contains the ID, Epic Name is blank.

The proposed workaround referenced in the link above suggests using automation to populate a new custom field, and also an option to load the new field for all previously created stories. Can you tell me if this automation only executes when a new issue is created after the automation has been created? If so, what happens if the name of the linked epic story is changed after the fact? Will all linked stories also get updated?

I'm not sure if there is a way or how to do this, but I would like to add my name to the list of people who would like to see an "Linked Epic Name" field as part of the "standard/default" functionality.  This field should contain the name of the linked epic and should be populated in the results returned from the REST API. Continuing to have the Epic ID in the Epic Link column is fine. I just need the linked Epic Name to be included when the issue is linked to an epic.

Thanks!
Jim
fields.summary: Populate the Epic Name field when retrieving issues via the REST API

fields.description:

We are looking for more granular permission control e.g: user can access 'Versions' and 'Components', but not 'Users and roles'.

fields.description:
Currently, if you have multiple validators in a workflow transition and all the validators are failing, only the topmost validator error will be displayed to the user.

It would be more efficient to run all validators and show all errors to the user.
Eg: in the validators below, if all the fields are empty, Jira will only show the validator error for *field3* since it is on top of the list:
 !image-2021-06-09-14-54-10-216.png|thumbnail! 

Once field3 is used, then it will show the error for field2 and so on.
fields.summary: Jira should show all validator errors during transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever WebHooks are triggered, during the process of building a JSON body to be sent, Jira will fetch data for certain fields directly at the database (e.g. fields from Advanced Roadmaps).

The implementation of this mechanic, returns Iterable of custom fields definitions + function retrieving data for them. It is then called two times separately to create two different data structures. It is not necessary, because data structures are not filtering the output, they are just retrieving custom fields' names.

When a significant amount of WebHooks is set to be triggered on issue operations, this can increase the time Jira will take to finish executing issue actions, causing performance issues for end users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Jira instance with Advanced Roadmaps
# Populate a Jira issue with Advanced Roadmaps fields (e.g. Target start and Target end)
# Create a few WebHooks set to be triggered on issue_updated events, then set them to be triggered at the affected issue
# Add a comment at the affected issue

h3. Expected Results
Jira will query the database once to build the JSON from the issue to be sent through WebHooks.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will query the database twice for each WebHook that was triggered, increasing the response time from Jira.

h3. Workaround
TBD
fields.summary: WebHooks plugin fetches custom field data from the database twice, causing performance issues

fields.description:
Currently, if you have multiple validators in a transition, if the top validator in the list fails during the transition Jira will show only this top validator error before running the remaining validators in the transition.

In some specific use cases as an Admin I would like to have the ability to change the validator order so that I can decide which error will be shown to the users first.

Eg: in the fields validators below, I would like the users to see the 'Linked URL' validator error first, but if they didn't populate the Field3, the error for Linked URL will not show up during the transition validators:

 !image-2021-06-09-14-46-54-469.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround:

As an admin, I can recreate the validators in the order I prefer.
fields.summary: Ability to reorder validators in a workflow transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The search criteria for Insight custom field is removed from the JQL when other criteria are added later in Basic search

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight custom field, configure it accordingly so that it can be assigned an object in a Jira issue.
 # In Basic search, filter by this Insight custom field and validate the search result.
 # Add another search criteria to filter by project and search again.
 # Switch to Advanced search and check the JQL.

h3. Expected Results
The JQL contains both filter for the Insight custom field and the project
{code}
"Insight field" = AD-7 AND project = ITSD
{code}

h3. Actual Results
(i) Here's a quick video to demonstrate the issue:  [^basicSearch.mov] 
The JQL contains only the filter for project like
{code}
project = ITSD
{code}

h3. Workaround
Use Advanced search or select/filter the Insight custom field(s) last

h3. Notes
* Tested with more than 1 Insight custom field in the JQL, all search criteria related to Insight custom fields are removed if these were added before other search criteria for non-Insight custom fields
* Tested with a standard Jira custom field (e.g. Select list). The search criteria doesn't get removed regardless of the sequence of adding the search criteria in Basic search
fields.summary: The search criteria for Insight custom field is removed from the JQL when other criteria are added later in Basic search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Regarding [https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/oauth-error-oauth_problem-signature_invalid-720406720.html], suggested KB talks about changing the useBodyEncodingForURI to false but Jira Docker image doesn't have any parameter to change this value other than the default.
h3. Expected Results

Jira Docker Image should have a parameter for changing the *useBodyEncodingForURI* to false in the server.xml file. server.xml.j2 (jinja template) should have that value as a parameter.
h3. Actual Results

Currently, it shows true and that is the default value. We can't change this value to false.
h3. Workaround

Manually update the server.xml.j2 file with proper information and restart the Jira container.
fields.summary: docker image Jira-server, useBodyEncodingForURI set as parameter

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Jira Data Center allow remote attackers to discover the username of users via an enumeration vulnerability in the REST API.

CVE-2021-26081

The affected versions are before version 8.5.14, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.6, from version 8.14.0 before 8.16.1, from version 8.17.0 before 8.16.2, and from version 8.17.0 before 8.17.0.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.14
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.6
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.16.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.14
 * 8.13.6
 * 8.16.1
 * 8.16.2
 * 8.17.0
fields.summary: Username enumeration on Jira Software Server 8.15 - CVE-2021-26081

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When upgrading Jira to versions using SAML/SSO plugin version >4.2, if there's a dismissible warning then you won't be able to ignore the errors and continue.

The UI will break with the following error when you hit "Ignore all warnings and continue"

 !image-2021-06-07-21-03-28-239.png|thumbnail! 

This happens because the new authentication methods provided by the SSO plugin version 4.2 retrieves the available directories through the endpoint {{/rest/authconfig/1.0/login-options}}, however, this endpoint is not whitelisted on Johnson's filter whitelist so a 503 is received by the plugin when trying to retrieve it, here is the list of allowed URLs:

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-07 at 9.08.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up more than one authentication method in *Authentication Methods* (available as of 4.2);
** Additionally, if upgrading from for Jira 8.5 and having set up SAML as a secondary authentication, it will trigger the problem as well;
 # Upgrade Jira to a higher version;
 # The instance should either have some sort of configuration problem that would prompt a warning Johnson Page;
 # Click the "Ignore all warnings and continue" button

h3. Expected Results

The admin is able to dismiss the warnings page and log in on the node. 

h3. Actual Results

The user is unable to log in, so the error message cannot be dismissed from the UI.

h3. Workaround

h6. Option 1

Fix the warnings displayed in the Johnson's page.

h6. Option 2

Add the following parameter to your [*start-up properties*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]:

 * {{-Djira.startup.warnings.disable=true}}

h3. Notes

Starting in Jira 8.16, we have upgraded the Postgres driver version. This new version enforces the {{socketTimeout}} parameter (JRASERVER-71982) and will bring Johnson's warning page if the user doesn't add them, thus increasing the likelihood of users facing this problem.
fields.summary: SAML/SSO v4.2.x  as a secondary authentication breaks upgrade when there's a Johnson dismissible warning
REST API for finding projects where a user is project administrator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When sending a issue update webhook on a comment operations (create/edit/delete), the {{updated}} field for the issue is not up-to-date.

After the webhook is sent, we can see the {{updated}} is actually updated.

(i) Note: for webhooks triggered from issue fields updated, the {{updated}} field has the correct value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a webhook for when the issue is updated
 # Enable {{com.atlassian.webhooks}} as DEBUG, to see the payload in the logs
 # Add/edit/delete a comment in an issue

h3. Expected Results

The {{updated}} field for the issue has the same date as the last updated comment.

h3. Actual Results

The {{updated}} field for the issue has the value from before the comment was added/edited/deleted.

h3. Workaround

Instead of using the {{updated}} field, please use the {{timestamp}} when:
* {{"webhookEvent": "jira:issue_updated"}}
AND 
* {{issue_event_type_name}} is like {{issue_comment*}}

It might not be a 100% match with the {{updated}} field, but it's a valid approximation.
fields.summary: Sending a issue update webhook on a comment operations, the updated field is not up-to-date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a node in a clustered Data Center environment is synchronizing a user directory and ungracefully shuts down or crashes (including ungraceful shutdowns where Tomcat is unable to stop within the configured time limit in shutdown scripts), the synchronization job becomes orphaned and the rest of the cluster will not recognize that the job is no longer ongoing.

Neither a rolling restart of individual nodes or a complete shutdown of the entire cluster seems to resolve the issue, as the synchronization appears to continue even after the cluster is shut down and a single node is brought up. It's likely that the job state is held within the database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install and configure at least a 2 node DC
# Initiate a user directory synchronization on one node
# Before the synchronization completes, ungracefully terminate the node performing the synchronization (i.e. kill -9)

h3. Expected Results
The remaining nodes can recognize that the responsible node is no longer alive, removes the orphaned job, and allows for another sync job to be scheduled.

h3. Actual Results

The job continues to run indefinitely.

 !image-2021-06-07-12-46-46-305.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

*TBD*

In the specific circumstance where ungraceful shutdowns are due to Tomcat being unable to stop within the configured time limit in shutdown scripts, modify the shutdown scripts (i.e. stop-jira.sh) to extend the time limit beyond the default 20 seconds in order to avoid the forced shutdown of Tomcat.
fields.summary: Stale User Directory Synchronization Job in Clustered DC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The validation step of the CSV issue-import process should at least warn and explain the consequences (if not error out) of having a subtask assigned to an epic in the CSV file. Currently, nothing gets raised at the validation stage. On some versions of Jira, we silently continue through the actual import without any errors (<8.10, >=8.13.7). On others, we blow up (~8.11-8.13.6).
Neither of these outcomes is desirable. I want Jira to warn me at the validation stage if there are instances of subtasks being assigned to epics, and the warning should state that Jira will ignore these assignments and have the new subtasks inherit from the parent task. Then, the actual import process should do exactly that.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Same as in JRASERVER-71995 or JRASERVER-71880.
h3. Expected Results

The validator raises a warning when a subtask is assigned to the same Epic as its parent. Technically, subtasks cannot have their own epic assignments; they inherit them.

When a subtask is assigned to a different epic than its parent, either:
 * A stronger warning is raised, and the user is informed that the affected subtask will not have the intended epic assignment.
 * an error is raised and the CSV data must be fixed before the import operation can be performed.

h3. Actual Results

The validation passes with no problems, and the import is allowed to continue.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The CSV Issue Importer Validator Does Not Flag Subtasks Assigned to Epics As A Problem

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When starting Jira, the /status endpoint returns only once the "\{"state":"STARTING"}" with HTTP status 200 output during Jira startup process.
 Subsequent curl commands do not return response and gets HTTP status 503
 Trying /status in the Browser keeps blank.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Server or DC
 # Run curl locally using: "while true; do curl -v [http://<nodehostname>:<port>/status]; sleep 1;done"
 # Start Jira and check curl outputs.

h3. Expected Results

The /status REST API should return the "\{"state":"STARTING"}" during the startup process.
h3. Actual Results

The /status returns the "\{"state":"STARTING"}" (with HTtP status 200) only the very first try.
{noformat}
*   Trying 127.0.0.1:8080...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to localhost (127.0.0.1) port 8080 (#0)
> GET /status HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8080
> User-Agent: curl/7.68.0
> Accept: */*
>
* Mark bundle as not supporting multiuse
< HTTP/1.1 200      << -------
< X-AREQUESTID: 1199x1x1
< Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
< Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000
< X-AUSERNAME: anonymous
< Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
< Content-Length: 20
< Date: Thu, 03 Jun 2021 19:59:17 GMT
<
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
{"state":"STARTING"}*   << -------{noformat}

All the next tries on /status will return HTTP status code 503 and blank answer

{noformat}
*   Trying 127.0.0.1:8080...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to localhost (127.0.0.1) port 8080 (#0)
> GET /status HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8080
> User-Agent: curl/7.68.0
> Accept: */*
>
* Mark bundle as not supporting multiuse
< HTTP/1.1 503     << -------
< X-AREQUESTID: 1199x3x1
< Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
< Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000
< Retry-After: 30
< Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
< Date: Thu, 03 Jun 2021 19:59:19 GMT
< Connection: close
<
* Closing connection 0
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The /status endpoint URL does not return STARTING when Jira is starting up

fields.description:
This knowledge base specifies how to "[How to enable Autocomplete Renderer for Multi-Select Custom Field in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-enable-autocomplete-renderer-for-multi-select-custom-field-in-jira-754978239.html]". It provides an option that you can apply to a specific custom field using javascript. 

This KB fails to call out another option that allows you to apply the same change to all multi-select custom fields in the instance. This is documented in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23013 where you can add the dark feature "multiselect.frother.renderer". Instructions for adding a dark feature can be found here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html

We should update the KB to include that option along with adding a link to the JAC ticket.
fields.summary: Update multi select knowledge base to include dark feature option

fields.description: Sometimes, failures in the replication/update for the application cache, can cause the cache from one or more nodes in a Jira data center environment to become unreliable/corrupted, and thus, it'd be great if we could have an endpoint that generates a status report for the application cache, similar to what we have for the node index on - [Index Summary endpoint|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.13.0/#api/2/index/summary-getIndexSummary].
fields.summary: Create a REST endpoint for validating the Jira internal cache

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When having two identical outward description, Jira will only show one for linking issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 issue linking with the same outward description, and different inward description
 !image-2021-06-04-11-20-12-592.png|thumbnail!

 # Try Linking 2 issues, you will notice only one option appears
 !image-2021-06-04-11-23-03-716.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should not allow two identical outward description, 

h3. Actual Results
Jira allows two identical outward description, resulting in only one showing for the user and always linking to the same inward description, which causes confusion to the user.


h3. Workaround
Edit the outward descriptions so they are different.
fields.summary: Having 2 equal Outward Description on Link Issues results on only 1 option

fields.summary: Send health check notification via email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A User who has permission to Edit Dashboard loses its Edit permission when the Dashboard is shared with a Group of which User is not part of.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Created a new Dashboard: _Test Dashboard_
* _agent1_  was given the Edit permission to Dashboard
* The Dashboard is shared with group: _jira-software-users_ and agent1 is part of the group
* Logged in as agent1 and I could see I am able to Edit the Dashboard

* The Dashboard is shared with another group: _jira-software-users-1_ for which agent1 is NOT part of the group. I could see the Edit permission is removed for the user: agent1

h3. Expected Results
agent1 should still have the Edit permission

h3. Actual Results
agent1 looses the permission to Edit Dashboard


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dashboard Edit permission is removed when a Dashboard is shared a specific Group

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, customer can go to JSM project settings and make any field as Required, but this will also forced the Request types for the Email request type to have this field as required.
There is nothing in the mail logs or application logs to indicate an actual error occurred vs a system check to cause the error as shown. Error was shown in JSM mail log audit/processing area

 !image-2021-06-04-17-25-21-272.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Suggested Solution
There should be a warning in the JSM project settings when additional field is made required that it will affect the functionality of the Email request-Request types function or those field should not be added automatically to the Visible Required filed but as Hidden fields.
 !image-2021-06-04-17-28-32-802.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Required fields warning for JSM project

fields.description:
When customer adds a bullet to a comment field, Jira automatically inserts an indentation to the right. Customer wants to have the ability to add the bullets without indentation so they can be aligned at left margin of the paragraph.

Example:

How it is currently:

This is a test
* test 1
* test 2
* test 3

What user wants it to be:

This is a test
• test 1
• test 2
• test 3
fields.summary: Add bullets to comment fields without indentation
